title: Into the Void Hub
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:last-frontier]]

[[module CSS]]

div#header {
    background-image: url('https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/into-the-void-hub/ITTV_PRIDE_LOGO.png') !important;
}

[[/module]]

[[module CSS]]
#header h1 a::before {
    content: "SCP Foundation";
}
 
#header h2::before {
    content: "SECURE - CONTAIN - PROTECT";
    text-shadow: 0rem 0rem 0.3125rem #000000;
}
[[/module]]
@@ @@



[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]




[[=image http://scp-sandbox-3.wikidot.com/local--files/vivarium-3/BingoBangoGoesToTokyo.gif width="300px"]]

[[=]]

+ The Beholder Program

[[/=]]


[[div class="blockquote"]]
Hello, my name is Dr. Rynhart. I am the head researcher overseeing The Beholder Program. You have been personally selected to join this program due to your work ethic, interpersonal skills, and lack of major disciplinary violations. Welcome to the team!

You may not have heard of this department before, and that is partially due to how new this all is. Space was always thought to be an endless void that we would only ever get to see a small portion of, but with recent leaps in technology, space is within our grasps. We have engineers building the fastest rockets, programmers advancing the realm of artificial intelligence, and a few brave men and women who are willing to travel into that void.

This is where you come in. We need young researchers who are willing to get to work and collect as much data as possible. We have thousands of logs and images that have been collected from our Beholder line of satellites. You will be the backbone of this initiative, so are you ready to get to work?
[[/div]]
@@ @@



-----

@@ @@

[[div class="block"]]
[[table style="border: none; width: 100%"]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="width: 20%;"]]
[[f<image Binary_Star_Loop_Blink.gif]]
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="text-align: left;"]]
{{Hello, my name is [[[scp-5857|Binary Star]]]. It is nice to meet you. I will be helping you navigate the files I am currently monitoring. I will be here if you have any questions or concerns.}}
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]
[[/div]]


@@ @@
-----
@@ @@
= [[size 1.2em]]__**Major Observations**__[[/size]]
@@ @@
= [[[scp-5623|SCP-5623 "Star Euthanizer"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= Current location of the anomaly is unknown. Attempts to relocate are ongoing.

= [[[scp-5843|SCP-5843 "Eyewitness"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= Observation will continue once contact has been reestablished.

= [[[scp-4524|SCP-4524 "A Flesh, New World"]]] by [[*user BlueJones]]
= Observation is ongoing. No significant reports have been made.

= [[[scp-5651|SCP-5651 "Wretched Core"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= Emergence is eminent. Observation is ongoing.

= [[[scp-5979|SCP-5979 "Star Crossed Lovers"]]] by [[*user Marceline_Raynes]]
= Threat is no longer eminent. Data yields sufficient.

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-3195|SCP-3195 "The fault in our Star"]]] by [[*user Marceline_Raynes]]
= Extraterrestrial life confirmed. Yields are significant. 

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-5943|SCP-5943 "A Solar Conversation"]]] by [[*user Dr Itzhak]]
= Beholder-Probe 16 has been launched. Preparing for multi-solar exploration.

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6524|SCP-6524 "A God-Awful Small Affair"]]] by [[*user BlueJones]]
= Contact with lifeform has ceased. Attempting to re-establish contact.

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6701|SCP-6701 "Shooting Star Swallow"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= Once upon a time, there was a little bird that flew...

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6983|SCP-6983 "Kelvin"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= What do you mean "It broke thermodynamics"?

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6143|SCP-6143 "Spooky Spacey Skeletons"]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= We stared into space and found dead.

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7233|SCP-7233 "The Astroneer"]]] by [[*user SYTYCFanon]]
= There's no greater terror in space than losing the one you love.

= [[[scp-7928|SCP-7928 “THREAT LEVEL: NULL”]]] by [[*user Everturning]]
= In space, no one cares that you think you’re threatening. And evidence shows you’re not.

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7169|SCP-7169 "Big Atmosphere Planetary GF"]]] by [[*user Marceline_Raynes]]
= Love is found even in the depths of space. 

= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7713|SCP-7713 "Green with Envy"]]] by [[*user Iszth]]
= You took everything from us. But we will take it back.
@@ @@

= [[size 1.2em]]__**Cosmic Events**__[[/size]]
@@ @@
= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/space-cadet-semantics|Space Cadet Semantics]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= D-Class successfully launched, collecting data...
@@ @@
= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/it-s-better-to-burn-out-than-to-fade-away|It's Better To Burn Out, Than To Fade Away]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= You've met with a terrible fate, haven't you?
@@ @@
= [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/ad-fundum-universum-ad-fundum|Ad Fundum Universum, Ad Fundum]]] by [[*user Sirslash47]]
= You're gonna need an out of this world drink for this one.

[[=]]
[[collapsible show="How To Contribute" hide="How To Contribute"]]

@@ @@

[[=]]
+++ How to contribute
[[/=]]
[[div class="blockquote"]]

So... what is this?

Well, this is a collection of articles centered around the strange, and odd things that live in space, and a sentient AI named Binary Star. The themes of these articles revolve around the curiosity of the unknown, and the curiosity of finding them.

With this being said, any article a part of this hub must be fairly grounded, so any anomalies attached to this hub must fairly limited in their ability to affect earth. Space is scary enough as it is.

The Foundation must also be naïve to the inner workings of the anomalies. Space is big and weird. No one knows why or how these things exist, they just do. Any knowledge on the inner workings of the SCP should be hinted at, and not told bluntly.

Now this isn't to say you can't add a very powerful SCP, or a highly in depth article to this hub. It just isn't what the hub is all about. If you have any doubts just go ahead and ask if it works or not (this is encouraged if you want to intertwine your piece in any story line).

**Major Observations** are any articles that fall into the themes of this hub.

**Cosmic Events** are the same as Major Observations, but they are tales. This will be expanded on  in the near future.

If you would like help with an idea, or if you want to add to this hub, contact [[*user Sirslash47]]. Currently we don't have a timeline etc. so it is suggested to read the current articles to check if your idea is not conflicting already established events.

This hub uses the [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/theme:last-frontier | Last Frontier Theme]]] made by [[*user Vivarium]], and can be used for SCPs, and Tales in this setting (this is not mandatory). To import this theme to your page, put the following text anywhere inside it:
@@ @@
